Data.event_text: 13 January  Turkey launches airstrikes against Kurdish militants in Iraq and Syria following an attack on Turkish soldiers in Iraq which killed nine.

links.text: -"Turkey launches airstrikes against Kurdish militants in Iraq and Syria after 9 soldiers were killed". AP News. 13 January 2024. Retrieved 13 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 January  The Grand National Assembly of Turkey approves Sweden's NATO membership bid.

links.text: -Sariyuce, Isil; Gretener, Jessie; Wilson, Kristin (23 January 2024). "Turkish parliament approves Sweden's NATO membership bid". CNN. Retrieved 24 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 January  President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan signs and approves the proposal containing Sweden's accession protocol to NATO.

links.text: -"Cumhurbaşkanı Erdoğan, İsveç'in NATO üyeliği kararını onayladı" (in Turkish). ntv.com.tr. 25 January 2024. Archived from the original on 6 February 2024. Retrieved 6 February 2024.-
-"Cumhurbaşkanı Erdoğan, İsveç'in NATO üyeliği kararını onayladı" (in Turkish). ntv.com.tr. 25 January 2024. Archived from the original on 6 February 2024. Retrieved 6 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 January  2024 Istanbul church shooting One person is killed and another is injured during a shooting by two gunmen at the Church of Santa Maria in Istanbul.

links.text: -"2 masked assailants attack a Roman Catholic church in Istanbul and kill 1 person". AP News. 28 January 2024. Retrieved 28 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 February  A gunman takes seven hostages at a factory owned by U.S. company Procter & Gamble in Gebze, Kocaeli Province, in an apparent protest against the Gaza war. The perpetrator is later arrested unharmed and all the hostages are freed.

links.text: -Staff (1 February 2024). "Procter & Gamble staff held hostage in Turkish factory freed in police raid". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2 February 2024.-
-Staff (1 February 2024). "Procter & Gamble staff held hostage in Turkish factory freed in police raid". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 6 February  Two Revolutionary People's Liberation Party/Front gunmen open fire outside the Istanbul Justice Palace, wounding six people, before being killed during a shootout with police.

links.text: -"Turkish police kill 2 attackers after assault on Istanbul court injures 6". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 6 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 February   Gunmen open fire at a campaign event in the Küçükçekmece district municipality of Istanbul for AK Party mayoral candidate Aziz Yeniay, critically injuring one person. Seventeen people are arrested in connection with the attack.

links.text: -"17 people detained after attack at Istanbul election campaign event, official says". Associated Press. 11 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 13 February  Nine miners are killed after a landslide near the Çöpler mine in İliç, Erzincan Province.

links.text: -"Mijnwerkers onder puin in goudmijn na aardverschuiving Turkije". nos.nl (in Dutch). 13 February 2024. Retrieved 14 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 February  Turkey launches an airstrike in northern Iraq, killing four alleged PKK members.

links.text: -"4 PKK terrorists 'neutralized' in northern Iraq". Hürriyet Daily News. 25 February 2024. Retrieved 26 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 March  One person is killed in Bursa Province following a magnitude 4.9 earthquake that had its epicenter in Çanakkale Province.

links.text: -"Moderate earthquake causes panic in western Turkey, leading to 1 death". Turkish Minute. 5 March 2024. Retrieved 19 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 March  A migrant boat sinks near Gökçeada in the Aegean Sea, killing 22 people including seven children. Two people are rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard off Eceabat, Çanakkale Province while two others manage to swim to shore.

links.text: -"Migrant boat sinks off Turkish Aegean coast, killing at least 22 people". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 15 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2021 March  2024 World Athletics Race Walking Team Championships at Antalya

links.text: -"World Race Walking Team Championships" (Press release). World Athletics.org. 22 March 2023. Retrieved 5 November 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Turkish local elections

links.text: -Alper Coşkun (1 June 2023). "Erdoğan's Next Fight". Carnegie Endowment for International Peace. Retrieved 9 November 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2024 Istanbul mayoral election Ekrem İmamoğlu is re-elected as mayor of Istanbul.

links.text: -"Istanbul Mayor Race". The New York Times. 31 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: Gayrettepe nightclub fire  A fire at a nightclub in Beşiktaş, Istanbul kills at least 29 people.

links.text: -Zaman, Tanem; Alam, Hande Atay (2 April 2024). "Fire at Istanbul nightclub kills dozens during renovation work, state media says". CNN. Retrieved 2 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: Authorities annul the victory of DEM candidate Abdullah Zeydan in the mayoral election in Van and declare his rival from the AK Party the winner instead. Following public uproar and an appeal from Zeydan, the Supreme Election Board reinstates him as the winner.

links.text: -"Turkey replaces Kurdish mayor with government candidate two days after vote". Euractiv. 3 April 2024. Archived from the original on 3 April 2024. Retrieved 3 April 2024.-
-"Turkey replaces Kurdish mayor with government candidate two days after vote". Euractiv. 3 April 2024. Archived from the original on 3 April 2024. Retrieved 3 April 2024.-
-"Turkey's top election authority restores newly elected pro-Kurdish mayor's right to hold office". Associated Press. 3 April 2024. Retrieved 3 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 April - One person is killed and seven others are injured after a cable car falls on rocky ground due to a collapsed pylon outside Antalya. The accident also leaves 184 people stranded across the entire cable car system.

links.text: -"One killed and 184 stranded midair after cable car collapses in Turkey". The Guardian. 12 April 2024. Retrieved 13 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 April - A magnitude 5.6 earthquake hits Tokat Province, destroying several buildings there and in neighboring Yozgat Province.

links.text: -"A magnitude 5.6 quake hits central Turkey, damaging some homes. No serious injuries are reported". Associated Press. 19 April 2024. Retrieved 19 April 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2 May  Turkey suspends all trade with Israel in response to their conduct in the war in Gaza, after previously suspending exports in a limited category of goods in April.

links.text: -Jolly, Jasper (2 May 2024). "Turkey reportedly halts all trade with Israel over war in Gaza". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2 May 2024.-
-Jolly, Jasper (2 May 2024). "Turkey reportedly halts all trade with Israel over war in Gaza". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Turkish Air Force carries out airstrikes on Iraqi Kurdistan, reportedly killing 16 PKK insurgents.

links.text: -"Turkey strikes northern Iraq from air, says it kills PKK members". Reuters. 6 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Byzantine-era Chora church in Istanbul formally reopens to Muslim worshippers as a mosque.

links.text: -"Turkey formally opens another former Byzantine-era church as a mosque". AP News. 6 May 2024. Retrieved 6 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 May  A Boeing 737 passenger aircraft belonging to Corendon Airlines makes an emergency landing at GazipaşaAlanya Airport after one of its tires bursts.

links.text: -"Boeing 737: Plane skids off runway in Senegal, tyre bursts in Turkey". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 9 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 13 May  President Erdoğan meets with Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis in Ankara.

links.text: -"Turkey's Erdogan meets Greek PM, sees 'no unsolvable problems' in ties". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 9 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 17 May  President Erdoğan issues pardons to seven senior military officers who were sentenced to life imprisonment in 2018 for their role in the 1997 Turkish military memorandum that ousted Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan.

links.text: -"Turkey's Erdogan pardons elderly generals imprisoned over 1997 'postmodern coup'". Associated Press. 17 May 2024. Retrieved 17 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 26 May - Ten people are killed and 39 others are injured after a bus collides with three other vehicles in the Tarsus district near Mersin.

links.text: -"Ten dead, 39 injured in southern Turkey highway collision". Reuters. 26 May 2024. Retrieved 26 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 31 May  Turkey launches drone strikes on Syrian Democratic Forces targets in Qamishli, Syria, killing four militants and injuring 11 civilians.

links.text: -"Turkish drone strikes in Syria kill 4 U.S.-backed fighters, wound 11 civilians, Kurdish group says". Associated Press. 31 May 2024. Retrieved 4 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2 June - One person is killed and eight others are injured after an apartment building collapses in Küçükçekmece, Istanbul.

links.text: -"1 dead and 8 injured in Istanbul apartment building collapse". Associated Press. 2 June 2024. Retrieved 2 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 June - Mehmet Sıddık Akış, the DEM mayor of Hakkâri, is removed from office and arrested on suspicion of having links with the PKK. He is sentenced to 19 years' imprisonment over the charges on 5 June.

links.text: -"Pro-Kurdish lawmakers stage protest in Turkey's parliament to denounce the ouster of a new mayor". Associated Press. 5 June 2024. Retrieved 5 June 2024.-
-"Erdoğan defends dismissal, sentencing of Hakkari mayor". Hürriyet Daily News. 5 June 2024. Retrieved 5 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 June - An SF-260D trainer aircraft of the Turkish Air Force crashes into farmland near Kayseri, killing its two pilots.

links.text: -"A military training plane crashes in central Turkey, killing its 2 pilots". Associated Press. 4 June 2024. Retrieved 4 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 June - 2024 Turkey wildfires  A crop fire in the border between Mardin and Diyarbakır Provinces leaves 11 people dead and ravages three settlements.

links.text: -"A fire that spread through settlements in Turkey left 11 dead. Greece evacuates villages for safety". Associated Press. 21 June 2024. Retrieved 21 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 June - The Financial Action Task Force removes Turkey from its "gray list" of countries not fully complying with measures to combat money laundering and terrorism financing.

links.text: -"Turkey welcomes removal from a key money-laundering watchlist, hoping to boost foreign investment". Associated Press. 28 June 2024. Retrieved 28 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 June to 7 July  2024 FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup

links.text: -"U17 and U19 Youth World Cups hosts confirmed for 2024–2027". FIBA. 29 November 2022. Retrieved 5 November 2023.-

Data.event_text: Five people are killed after a propane tank explodes inside a restaurant in İzmir.

links.text: -"A propane tank explosion in western Turkey has killed 5 people and injured 63 others". Associated Press. 1 July 2024. Retrieved 1 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: A riot targeting Syrian refugees in Melikgazi, Kayseri Province, leads to the arrest of 67 people.

links.text: -"Turkey's president accuses opposition of stoking racism after anti-Syrian rioting erupts". Associated Press. 2 July 2024. Retrieved 2 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 July  Seven people are killed after anti-Turkish protests break out in Turkish-occupied Northern Syria following anti-Syrian riots in Turkey a day earlier.

links.text: -"Seven protesters killed in north Syria clashes with Turkish forces: new toll". Associated Press. 2 July 2024. Retrieved 2 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 July  Germany summons Turkey's ambassador in Berlin in a tit-for-tat move over footballer Merih Demiral's wolf salute gesture while celebrating a goal at the UEFA Euro 2024.

links.text: -Schmidt, Nadine (4 July 2024). "Germany summons Turkish ambassador as row erupts over alleged right-wing salute goal celebration at Euro 2024". CNN. Retrieved 4 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 July  A life raft carrying migrants bound for Europe sinks off the coast of Çeşme after being reportedly pushed back by Greek authorities, killing seven people.

links.text: -"Migrant raft crashes into rocks and sinks off Turkish coast, killing 7. Nineteen others are rescued". Associated Press. 9 July 2024. Retrieved 9 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 July  The Grand National Assembly of Turkey approves a law aiming to euthanize a portion of the country's four million stray dogs, specifically targeting those that are sick or deemed aggressive.

links.text: -"Turkey approves controversial stray dog cull". South China Morning Post. 29 July 2024. Retrieved 29 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Turkish defense ministry says that it targeted Kurdish militants in northern Iraq with air strikes, killing 13 people.

links.text: -"Turkey says it killed 13 Kurdish militants in northern Iraq". Reuters. 30 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: Turkey and Armenia resume talks aimed at normalizing diplomatic relations and agree to simplify visa rules for some passport holders.

links.text: -"Turkey, Armenia make progress in normalization talks". 30 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 August  2024 AmericanRussian prisoner exchange Twenty-six individuals are released from Ankara Esenboğa Airport in a prisoner exchange between the United States and Russia.

links.text: -Troianovski, Anton; Mazzetti, Mark; Hubbard, Ben (1 August 2024). "Russia Releases Evan Gershkovich in Sweeping Prisoner Swap, Turkish Officials Say". The New York Times. Retrieved 1 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2 August  Turkey blocks internet access to Instagram, following comments made by presidential communications director Fahrettin Altun that condemned Meta Platforms for taking down Instagram posts offering condolences or expressing sorrow towards the assassination of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh. The blockage is lifted on 10 August.

links.text: -"Turkey blocks access to Instagram platform but gives no reason". Reuters. 2 August 2024.-
-"Turkey suddenly reinstates access to Instagram after more than a week". Associated Press. 11 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 August  Turkey files a petition at the International Court of Justice to join the South African-led lawsuit against Israel over genocide charges in the Gaza war.

links.text: -"Turkey formally asks to join the genocide case against Israel at the UN court". Associated Press. 7 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 August  An intercity bus traveling from İzmir to Ağrı crashes into an overpass pillar in Polatlı, Ankara Province, killing nine people and injuring 26 others.

links.text: -"A bus crashes into a pillar of an overpass in Turkey, killing 9 people and injuring 26 others". Associated Press. 9 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 August  At least five people are injured in a knife attack at a mosque in Eskişehir. An 18-year old suspect is arrested.

links.text: -"Turkey arrests teenager for stabbing attack at mosque". Al Jazeera. 13 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 August  A brawl breaks out at the Grand National Assembly during a debate regarding the eligibility of imprisoned MP Can Atalay to assume his seat.

links.text: -"Lawmakers in Turkey draw blood in brawl during debate on jailed colleague". Associated Press. 16 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least 26 people are reported injured following days of wildfires in the İzmir area.

links.text: -"From paradise to hell: Aegean village stunned after Turkey fire". France 24. 18 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: An Israeli businessman of Palestinian origin is killed in a gun attack in Kağıthane municipality of Istanbul.

links.text: -"1 Israeli Arab killed and 2 wounded in a shooting on a street in Istanbul". Associated Press. 19 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 August  One person is killed and 38 others are injured, two of them seriously, when two Metrobus vehicles collide in Küçükçekmece, Istanbul.

links.text: -"Küçükçekmece'de metrobüsler çarpıştı: 1 ölü, 53 yaralı". TRT Haber (in Turkish). 29 August 2024. Retrieved 2 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: 30 August  The Turkish Military Academy sees women cadets become valedictorians of the three service branches of the Turkish Armed Forces for the first time. However, an investigation is subsequently launched after around 400 cadets were found to have taken an unauthorized secularist oath at their graduation ceremony.

links.text: -"Turkish president vows to 'purge' military graduates who took a pro-secular oath". Associated Press. 29 August 2024. Retrieved 8 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: Turkey formally applies to join the BRICS geopolitical bloc, citing the lack of progress in its accession to the European Union.

links.text: -"Turkey Bids to Join BRICS in Push to Build Alliances Beyond West". Bloomberg. Retrieved 2 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: Fifteen members of the Youth Union of Turkey are arrested on suspicion of assaulting two US Navy personnel in Izmir.

links.text: -"Turkey detains 15 members of anti-American youth group for assaulting 2 US servicemen". Associated Press. 2 September 2024. Retrieved 3 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 September  A Turkish drone strike kills three people, including a child, in Iraqi Kurdistan one day after a similar attack on a car in the region killed three people from the same family.

links.text: -"Drone Strike Kills 3 In Iraq's Kurdish Region: Official". Barron's. Retrieved 6 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: 6 September  Vistara Airlines Flight VTI027 going from Mumbai to Frankfurt makes an emergency landing at Erzurum Airport after receiving a bomb threat that turns out negative.

links.text: -"Bomb threat forces Vistara airline plane en route to Frankfurt to land in Turkey". Associated Press. 6 September 2024. Retrieved 7 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 September  The Turkish Ministry of Defense announces that a Turkish soldier was killed in clashes with the PKK in northern Iraq.

links.text: -"Turkish soldier killed in clashes with PKK terrorists in Iraq". Daily Sabah. 9 September 2024. Retrieved 9 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: Açık Radyo makes its final broadcast following a shutdown order from the Radio and Television Supreme Council on grounds of allegedly inciting hatred following comments made by a guest on the Armenian Genocide.

links.text: -"Turkey shuts down radio station in Armenia genocide row". France 24. 16 October 2024. Retrieved 16 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: A magnitude 5.9 earthquake hits Kale, Malatya, injuring at least 40 people across the east of the country.

links.text: -"An earthquake measuring 5.9 hits eastern Turkey, causing panic but no major damage". Associated Press. 16 October 2024. Retrieved 16 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 17 October  A bus carrying Japanese tourists crashes into a ditch in Afyonkarahisar Province, injuring 22 people.

links.text: -"Bus carrying Japanese tourists crashes in Turkey. 22 people are injured". Associated Press. 17 October 2024. Retrieved 17 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 October  A bus overturns in Aksaray Province, killing six people and injuring 25 others.

links.text: -"Six dead, 25 injured in Turkey bus accident". eKathimerini. 18 October 2024. Retrieved 18 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 October  Five people are killed while 22 others are injured in a gun and bomb attack on the headquarters of Turkish Aerospace Industries in Kahramankazan, Ankara Province that is blamed on the PKK. The two attackers are also killed.

links.text: -"At least five killed in attack on aerospace firm near Turkey's Ankara". Al Jazeera. 24 October 2024. Retrieved 24 October 2024.-
-"Turkey: Kurdish militant group behind attack on aerospace firm". BBC. 25 October 2024. Retrieved 26 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 30 October  Ahmet Özer, the CHP mayor of Esenyurt, Istanbul Province, is arrested on suspicion of having links with the PKK.

links.text: -"Mayor from Turkey's main opposition party is detained over alleged ties to Kurdish militants". Associated Press. 30 October 2024. Retrieved 30 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 November  The DEM mayors of Batman, Mardin and Halfeti are dismissed on suspicion of having links with the PKK.

links.text: -"Turkey sacks 3 pro-Kurdish mayors for 'terror ties'". France 24. 4 November 2024. Retrieved 4 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 November  At least 12 people are injured in an explosion and fire at an oil refinery of Tüpraş in Izmit.

links.text: -"Explosion at Turkish oil refinery injures 12". Associated Press. 5 November 2024. Retrieved 5 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 11 November  Former MKE Ankaragücü president Faruk Koca is convicted and sentenced to 3.5 years' imprisonment by a court in Ankara for assaulting a referee during a Süper Lig game in 2023.

links.text: -"Former Turkish soccer club president sentenced to prison for attacking referee". Associated Press. 11 November 2024. Retrieved 11 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 November  The DEM mayors of Tunceli and Ovacik are dismissed on suspicion of having links with the PKK.

links.text: -"Turkey removes two more pro-Kurdish mayors from office for links to banned group". Associated Press. 23 November 2024. Retrieved 23 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 November  The engine of a Sukhoi Superjet 100 aircraft operated by Azimuth catches fire shortly after landing in Antalya Airport from Sochi. All 95 passengers and crew on board are evacuated without injury.

links.text: -"Russian plane catches fire after landing in Turkey but passengers and crew are safely evacuated". Associated Press. 25 November 2024. Retrieved 25 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 December  Two military helicopters collide over Isparta Province, killing six personnel including a brigadier general.

links.text: -"Turkish military helicopters collide in midair, killing 6 military personnel". Associated Press. 9 December 2024. Retrieved 9 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 December  An ambulance helicopter crashes shortly after takeoff from a hospital in Muğla, killing all four people on board including two medical workers.

links.text: -"4 dead in Turkish ambulance helicopter crash". Associated Press. 22 December 2024. Retrieved 22 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 December  Eleven people are killed in an explosion at a factory producing explosives in Karesi, Balıkesir.

links.text: -"Eleven people killed in explosives factory blast in Turkey, minister says". Reuters. 24 December 2024. Retrieved 24 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 December  The owner of the Grand Isias Hotel in Adiyaman is convicted along with his son and an architect for manslaughter charges relating to the deaths of 72 people in the collapse of the hotel during the 2023 TurkeySyria earthquakes and sentenced to more than 18 years' imprisonment.

links.text: -"Owner and architect of Turkey quake collapse hotel jailed". BBC. 25 December 2024. Retrieved 25 December 2024.-
